issue.title: Crash during startup: `Render process is gone: Error: Reason: crashed, Exit Code: 132`

comment.body:
Ok, we seem to be in the same boat together what comes to the available HW support (ie no support whatsoever).
I wonder if we have to create a new ticket as this one is closed and if @scottnonnenberg-signal or somebody else is not willing to re-open this ticket anymore.

We do now have solid evidence that this problem is caused by the GDS security mitigation on Linux and it's going to affect all users with current Linux kernels but out of date HW (ie. not supported by Intel anymore).

issue.title: Crash during startup: `Render process is gone: Error: Reason: crashed, Exit Code: 132`

comment.body:
Some updates:
- I updated my BIOS/UEFI to the latest version (08/2023), but it did not include a microcode update for my cpu
- For Arch Linux, there is also a package [intel-ucode](https://gitlab.archlinux.org/archlinux/packaging/packages/intel-ucode/-/blob/main/PKGBUILD?ref_type=heads) for microkernel updates (if an update is provided by intel, but not deployed as BIOS/UEFI firmware update) - without success

TLDR: There is no microkernel update for my CPU. So I can use `gather_data_sampling=off` and be vulnerable or I can't use signal-desktop. And it [seems like](https://downfall.page/#faq) you want to have the mitigation turned on.

[This page](https://gitlab.com/iucode-tool/iucode-tool/-/blob/master/README?ref_type=heads) contains more information about how to update the microkernel and some inner details. The intel-ucode package uses the microcode updates provided by intel in this [Github Repo](https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files).

issue.title: Incorrect time (without restarting app) after a timezone change
issue.body:
<!--
Our bug tracker is ONLY for bugs. It is not for feature requests, questions, or comments.

Please fill out this template with all the information you have. We can't do much without
both the logs and a detailed description of what you've encountered. Please do your best!

Please note that this tracker is only for bugs. Please try these locations if you have a question or comment:

  https://community.signalusers.org/
  http://support.signal.org/
  support@signal.org

Lastly, be sure to preview your issue before saving. Thanks!
-->

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates
<!--
  You can search all issues here:
    https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue
  Replace [ ] with [X] once you've searched
-->
- [x] I am using Signal-Desktop as provided by the Signal team, not a 3rd-party package.
<!--
  If you're using a 3rd-party package, please report it to them first.
  For flatpak:
  - https://github.com/flathub/org.signal.Signal/issues
  For snap:
  - https://github.com/snapcrafters/signal-desktop/issues
  For archlinux:
  - https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/signal-desktop-beta/
  etc.
-->

---

### Bug Description

When the timezone changes, the Mac date/time updates as expected but the Signal desktop app timezone doesn't update. It updates only after restarting the app.

### Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Using bullet points, list the steps that reproduce the bug. -->

1. Have the desktop app open
2. Move to another timezone
3. Send a message on any chat (or do it from any linked device)

Actual Result:

See that the timestamps on the app are incorrect, but the Mac time may have updated properly

Expected Result:

Time for the sent message should match the new timezone, without requiring a restart.

### Screenshots

<!--
How to take screenshots on all OSes: https://www.take-a-screenshot.org/
You can drag and drop images into this text box.
-->

N/A

### Platform Info

Signal Version: 6.36.0 (production Apple Silicon)

<!-- You can see Signal's version number at Help -> About or File -> About Signal Desktop -->

Operating System:

Mac 14.0

Linked Device Version:

N/A

### Link to Debug Log

<!--
Immediately after the bug has happened, submit a debug log via View -> Debug Log, then copy that URL here.

In most cases, a log from your other devices is also useful:
  Android: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591#android_debug
  iOS: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591#ios_debug
-->
Unfortunately this debug log was generated after restarting the app. Not sure how helpful this would be: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/6.36.0/7191c1041c088f4b18647b23f0290e9c2fab1f27400ae40f13e821f7fa5de428.gz

issue.title: SQLITE_CORRUPT: database disk image is malformed

comment.body: Hello @therentabrain - unfortunately I don't have any other suggestions for troubleshooting from an application perspective (though I'm admittedly not as familiar with the application level as the folks from Signal). From a database perspective, the encrypted pages appear to be intact, so it might be possible to recover some of the underlying data using SQLite/SQLCipher recovery with the command line tool. I would only attempt that if there is critical information in the corrupted backup that you really need access to. It could prove to be a time consuming and possibly error prone process, and the results would not be easily importable back into an existing database (i.e. you'd might just be able to get a readable copy of some of the data in text/SQL).

commits.message: Accept profile keys for unknown members in groups
Fix system tray icon pixelated in Ubuntu Linux
Blur participant videos when calls are reconnecting
Focus keyboard shortcut for edit message
onCapturePaste: stop propagation in more scenarios
Don't process edits until attachmentDownloadQueue finishes
Ensure messageCache is updated when properties are unset
Fix stories tab title to be i18n
Centralize calling toasts and add imperative API

Add logging for deleted prekeys and other records

Co-authored-by: Scott Nonnenberg <scott@signal.org>

issue.title: Unable to paste from clipboard in the group description (also not working for the group name)
issue.body:
<!--
Our bug tracker is ONLY for bugs. It is not for feature requests, questions, or comments.

Please fill out this template with all the information you have. We can't do much without
both the logs and a detailed description of what you've encountered. Please do your best!

Please note that this tracker is only for bugs. Please try these locations if you have a question or comment:

  https://community.signalusers.org/
  http://support.signal.org/
  support@signal.org

Lastly, be sure to preview your issue before saving. Thanks!
-->

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates
<!--
  You can search all issues here:
    https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue
  Replace [ ] with [X] once you've searched
-->
- [ ] I am using Signal-Desktop as provided by the Signal team, not a 3rd-party package.
<!--
  If you're using a 3rd-party package, please report it to them first.
  For flatpak:
  - https://github.com/flathub/org.signal.Signal/issues
  For snap:
  - https://github.com/snapcrafters/signal-desktop/issues
  For archlinux:
  - https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/signal-desktop-beta/
  etc.
-->

**Please note:** I'm opening this issue here even though I am using the flatpak build maintained by Flathub, because this bug is **also happening in the official Signal desktop client for Mac.** This leads me to assume this is not about if you are using an official build or not, but something else in the application.

---

### Bug Description

<!-- Give an overall summary of the issue. -->

Unable to paste in the group description or in the group name. It has worked before, but today, neither simple strings from the clipboard, or links worked. Nothing got entered into the input fields.

Since the keyboard shortcut for voice messages is triggered globally (even when the group settings are open, and the edit group name + group description modal), I suspect the CTRL+SHIFT+V keyboard shortcut for recording a voice message might for the currently open chat could be interfering with the paste command in the group settings and the edit group modal. This should likely be resolved in another issue, but it is weird to accidentally trigger a voice recording when editing the group settings. 

### Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Using bullet points, list the steps that reproduce the bug. -->

1.  Open a group chat
2. Open group settings
3. Hover the group name and press the edit button (pen icon)
4. Focus the group description text input field
5. Try to paste a string from the clipboard with CMD+V or CTRL+V
6. Try to paste a string from the clipboard by right clicking in the text input field and selecting "Paste"

Actual Result:

<!-- Describe the details of the buggy behaviour. -->
Nothing happens, the string is not pasted in by using either of the methods.


Expected Result:

<!-- Describe in detail what the correct behavior should be. -->

Both methods of pasting a message should work.


### Screenshots

<!--
How to take screenshots on all OSes: https://www.take-a-screenshot.org/
You can drag and drop images into this text box.
-->
![image](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop/assets/6125097/c8236a35-f82d-4fe9-89a6-1ae7d002f2ed)

### Platform Info

Signal Version: 6.35.0

<!-- You can see Signal's version number at Help -> About or File -> About Signal Desktop -->

Operating System:

<!-- Instructions for finding your OS version are here: http://whatsmyos.com/ -->

Fedora Linux 38

Linked Device Version:

<!-- Android: Settings -> Help,  iOS: Settings -> General -> About -->
6.36.5

### Link to Debug Log

<!--
Immediately after the bug has happened, submit a debug log via View -> Debug Log, then copy that URL here.

In most cases, a log from your other devices is also useful:
  Android: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591#android_debug
  iOS: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591#ios_debug
-->

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/6.35.0/cafc223924b50d2f7580165bdf11fe154d21190e40cb52f521ddbc22f4549905.gz

issue.title: Crash during startup: `Render process is gone: Error: Reason: crashed, Exit Code: 132`

comment.body:
> I think I figured out what's going on here. The Linux kernel disables AVX **before** the microcode update is loaded:
> 
> ```
> journalctl -k --grep=microcode -b -1
> kernel: SRBDS: Mitigation: Microcode
> kernel: GDS: Microcode update needed! Disabling AVX as mitigation.
> kernel: GDS: Mitigation: AVX disabled, no microcode
> kernel: microcode: Microcode Update Driver: v2.2.
> ```
> 
> Because AVX has been disabled, `/proc/cpuinfo` does not display it. But apparently Signal-Desktop uses a different method to detect AVX support, assumes that AVX is supported, calls an AVX instruction, and crashes.
> 
> Setting the [Linux kernel parameter](https://docs.kernel.org/admin-guide/kernel-parameters.html) `gather_data_sampling=off` fixes the issue. It keeps AVX enabled, so you must rely on the microcode update to mitigate the Gather Data Sampling hardware vulnerability. Please make sure that your microcode is enabled and mitigates the vulnerability _for your CPU model_.
> 
> Updating your BIOS might also fix this issue, as the BIOS microcode updates are probably loaded before the Linux kernel.

I've been hunting for the kernel commit that seems to cause the signal-desktop to crash on my old i7-6700K host and found out that this change broke signal-desktop on Debian 12:

commit ca5e8427e20d770b7b2ad0c4eafd17f4f77c7779
Author: Dave Hansen <dave.hansen@linux.intel.com>
Date:   Tue Aug 29 08:07:25 2023 -0700

    x86/speculation: Mark all Skylake CPUs as vulnerable to GDS
    
There problem is that this CPU isn't supported anymore by Intel and therefore there is no available microcode updates for this security issue and there also won't be one upcoming anymore.

Please, do check, what can be done for the signal-desktop to be fixed so that it would continue to work also with this CPU with the security mitigation enabled.

issue.title: Windows app blurry
issue.body:
- [X] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates

---

### Bug Description

The app randomly becomes blurry.

- it's not uniform - different parts of the app can be more or less blurry than others
- this includes text, icons, main menu, avatars and media
- hovering over elements or otherwise causing a redraw temporarily fixes it in that spot, only for it eventually become blurry again
- I have not seen this happen in any other app on this PC other than signal

### Steps to Reproduce

This happens randomly. Sometimes it can be ok for hours, sometimes it happens minutes after starting the app. Moving the main window around seems to trigger this faster.

Actual Result: blurry

Expected Result: not blurry :)

### Screenshots

![signal-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43295566/107231479-a4b8bc00-6a20-11eb-84ac-21f9d271de30.png)
![signal-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43295566/107231491-a71b1600-6a20-11eb-9f76-fb0886d67e94.png)


### Platform Info

Signal Version: 1.39.6

Operating System: Windows 10

Linked Device Version: 5.3.7.1

### Link to Debug Log

https://debuglogs.org/b2f3aad26dda3d3790c717ed7d7c1344c182d2940698163159cc5f58446486ec

comment.body: I am having this issue (mostly noting it with text blurring) with Signal 6.36.0 on Windows 11 despite FXAA being disabled (Nvidia).

issue.title: Option to send images with metadata
issue.body:
<!--
Please fill out this template with all the information you have. We can't do much without
both the logs and a detailed description of what you've encountered. Please do your best!

Please note that this tracker is only for bugs and feature requests. Please try these
locations if you have a question or comment:

  https://community.signalusers.org/
  http://support.signal.org/
  support@signal.org

Lastly, be sure to preview your issue before saving. Thanks!
-->

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates
  <!--
    You can search all issues here:
      https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue
    Replace [ ] with [X] once you've searched
  -->

---

### Feature Description

I would like to have the possibility to send picture files just as they are.

For privacy reasons it totally makes sense to strip all EXIF data in general. File names, recording timestamp, GPS coordinates and stuff. But I would like to have an option to share raw pictures with my best friends without using nextcloud links or email or so.

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Share a picture
2.  Download this pictures
3.  Try to figure out when or where it got captured

#### Actual Result:

You can often estimate if it is day or night, winter or summer by just watching the image.

#### Expected Result:

You have an option to just send the original timestamp and maybe all EXIF data quite with the file itself.

comment.body: this issue IS a bug. because it is a REGRESSION (sometime ago it was possible to send unstripped exif images, now it is not). what if I want to securely send someone an images containing important metadata? whatsapp allows for this purpose sending **files**, so you just pick a JPG/HEIC file from the mobile os Files app.
